title: 115_s3551
content: The Act is known as the "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" or "SOFFA". It adopts the California flammability standard as a federal standard. The "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" (SOFFA) adopts the California standard for bedding products. The standard is set by the Bureau of Electronic and Appliance Repair, Home Furnishings and Thermal Insulation of the Department of Consumer Affairs in Technical Bulletin 117-2013. The "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" (SOFFA) adopts the California standard for bedding products, as outlined in Technical Bulletin 117-2013. The Act defines terms such as "foundation," "mattress," and "upholstered furniture," specifying the characteristics of upholstered furniture intended for indoor use. The "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" (SOFFA) adopts the California standard for bedding products, specifying the characteristics of upholstered furniture intended for indoor use, including the definition of an arm that is made or sold with a cushion or pillow, regardless of attachment, and can be stuffed with any material. The "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" (SOFFA) defines upholstered furniture as an article of furniture that can support an individual's body or limbs when sitting upright or reclining, including furniture intended for children but excluding mattresses, foundations, bedding products, or furniture used exclusively for. The "Safer Occupancy Furniture Flammability Act" (SOFFA) defines upholstered furniture as furniture used for physical fitness and exercise. California's standard will be considered a flammability standard by the Consumer Product Safety Commission, with exceptions for testing and certification. Preemption clauses apply despite certain acts. The Flammable Fabrics Act and Consumer Product Safety Improvement Act restrict states from enforcing flammability laws on upholstered furniture, except for certain health-related regulations. This includes specific sections of the California Code of Regulations.
